description:
## Name
  aws-ExtendEbsVolume.
## Intent
  Extends EBS Volume
## Supported operating systems: 
  * Linux and Windows.
  * Tested on windows, amazon linux and ubuntu instances.
## Supported file systems: 
  * xfs 
  * ext4
  * NTFS
## Notes
  * A role with enough permissions should be provided for the document to be able to start or stop the configuration recording (otherwise the document will run with the caller identity).
  * Targeted instances must be managed by System Manager.
  * The operating systems types supported are Linux and Windows.
  * The MountPoint is required for linux.
  * The DriveLetter is required for windows.
  * The new size of the drive must be less than the maximum supported size for that partition in case of windows.
  * A snapshot from the EBS volume is created before extending it.
  * File systems supported are xfs, Ext4, NTFS.
## Minimum permissions required:
  * ssm:SendCommand.
  * ssm:DescribeInstanceInformation.
  * ssm:GetCommandInvocation.
  * ec2:CreateSnapshot.
  * ec2:DeleteSnapshot.
  * ec2:ModifyVolume.
  * ec2:CreateTags.
  * ec2:DescribeVolumes.

SizeGib.description: (Required) The target size to increase the volume to (in GiB).

MountPoint.description: (Optional) The mount point (such as "/", "/data", ...) of the partition which is to be increased(Required for Linux).

DriveLetter.description: (Optional) The drive letter which is to be increased(Required for windows).

keepSnapShot.description: (Optional) A boolean flag to determine whether to remove the created snapshot after successful resizing of the volume and the file system(True by default).

InstanceId.description: (Required) The identifier of the instance requiring increase of volume.

AutomationAssumeRole.description: (Optional) The ARN of the role that allows Automation to perform the actions on your behalf
